fields.description:
h3. Summary

The project key default pattern is the following: 

{code}[A-Z][A-Z0-9]+ {code}


If this pattern is not respected the following error will show up in the UI:

{code} We couldn't connect to that issue Make sure that this issue actually exists in that project. If it does, try again in a few minutes. If you still can't link to the issue, contact your Jira admin.  {code}
And the following error is thrown on the dev tool: 
{code}  sentFrom: "jira.frontend.issue.fetch.issue-fetch-epic",…}

...

buildKey: "JF-PROD-9526"
event: {message: "No project could be found with key ...  

... 

message: "FETCH_ISSUE_REQUEST: Failed to fetch issue data"
sentFrom: "jira.frontend.issue.fetch.issue-fetch-epic" {code}

 



*Note*: This pattern can be modified in the server environment. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to restore a backup from a Jira server instance in which the project key pattern is not respected. 
# Try to access the Jira issue in the new issue view

h3. Expected Results
* See the content of the Jira issue. 


h3. Actual Results
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
* The old issue view can fetch the data normally. So by adding the following to the URL, the user can see the content: 
{code} <instance_name>.atlassian.net/browse/<Issue_key>?oldIssueView=true{code}
fields.summary: The New Issue View cannot fetch data when the Default Project Key Pattern is not respected

fields.description: With the new changes in Jira, we are not able to see the number of licenses being used in Jira and Confluence. This will be really helpful for us to know when are we reaching the limit of users.
fields.summary: Ability to see the number of active users in Jira and Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding a new "Required Field" validator, clicking inside the available fields multi-selector, it is possible to start typing the name of the field to jump to it. It however does not override the shortcuts, so typing "c" triggers the "create Issue" modal.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
#Add Validator
#Select Field Required Validator
#Click in Available Fields selector
#Type "c"

h3. Expected Results

The selector jumps to the first field that starts with "c".

h3. Actual Results

The Selector jumps as expected, and the create issue modal is opened.


h3. Workaround
Holding shift while typing "c" will prevent the create issue modal from being triggered.
fields.summary: Hitting "c" key when selecting fields to require when adding validator triggers create new issue

fields.description: I love the Assignee filters which are generated automatically, but after a few go horizontally they go to the (+5) vertical list you need to expand to see them.  That is not quick, finding them is slow.  Custom Quick Filters doesn't show you any filters until you expand vertically, that is also not quick. To the right of all this is a vast expanse of whiteness, which would be a great place to put both the Assignee icons and the Quick Filters. Both filter types could expand to fit as many as possible before the end of the window, but there's some kind of wall keeping them out of the white space. It would be a wonderful world if we got rid of that imaginary wall and let the colorful icons spread out more into that wasted white space, then you'd have the best quick filters.
fields.summary: Make Quick Filters Great Again

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Open Chrome, add "Capture for Jira" add-on from [https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/zephyr-capture-for-jira/mmmjimhmoodbiejkjgcecaoibmochpnj|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/zephyr-capture-for-jira/mmmjimhmoodbiejkjgcecaoibmochpnj,]
 # Try filing any issue to jira.atlassian.com
 # Observe SSO not being picked up
 # Attempt to log in manually
 # Observe authentication failing
fields.summary: Capture for Jira isn't working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to attach a file with a special character (for example: "|"), Jira will display de following error:
{quote}We couldn't save your attachment
Reload the issue then try adding it again{quote} 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a file and add a | on the filename
# Try to add the file to an issue

h3. Expected Results
The file should be added

h3. Actual Results
Jira displays an error message
 !error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Remove the | from the filename and try attach it again.
fields.summary: Files with special characters cannot be attached to issues

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Currently, the *Project category* isn't available in the list of fields to use in the *Two Dimensional Filter Statistics* gadget.

[Adding Assigning And Deleting Project Categories|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/adding-assigning-and-deleting-project-categories-844500732.html]

h2. Proposed solution

Include this as a field in the gadget for a better overview using the gadget as it is currently only possible using advance JQL.
fields.summary: Add Project category to the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
It is not possible to create issues as an anonymous user, be it via the UI, or by directly passing an URL with the parameters.


h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Set the permissions in the target project:
** Grant the *Create Issues* permission to *Anyone*;
** Grant the *Modify reporter* permission to *Anyone*.
* Try to create an issue in the target project via URL as the example (without spaces): 
{panel}https://unlimitedjiraworks.atlassian.net/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid= *<project id>* &issuetype= *<issue type id>*&summary=Request%20for%20ACT%20to%20grant%20access%20to%20data&reporter=<*username*>{panel}
** The following error will be displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-05 at 13.24.25.png|thumbnail! 
* Try to create an issue via the UI:
 [^Create issue via UI.mp4] 


h3. Expected Results

The issue should be created since the permissions are correctly set.

h3. Actual Results

It is not possible to create an issue in any way.


h3. Workaround

In your project's field configuration, set the *Reporter* field as Optional. This will allow the reporter to be anonymous.

Just be careful, check if the field configuration is not shared with other projects:
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-05 at 18.24.24.png|thumbnail! 

If that's the case, create a copy from the existing one, and associate it to the desired project. You can then apply that without impacting in other projects.
fields.summary: Non logged in users can't create issues by defining a reporter

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer not able to view to issue summary/description of a linked issue in gadget.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to view to issue summary/description of a linked issue in gadget.

h3. Why this is important
Customers would like to view to issue summary/description of a linked issue in gadget
fields.summary: Ability to view to issue summary/description of a linked issue in gadget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Some users would like access to the apk for our mobile app to allow distribution to company devices that have purposely blocked the Google play store and Google services or are using custom Android ROM's   

 

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a secure apk download for registered customers. 

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Provide apk download of Android app

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There are situations when different Email notifications will have to be triggered for different stakeholders when an issue is transitioned to a certain Status.
For now, we can only trigger one event via a workflow post function. Allowing multiple Events to be triggered will help resolve the above problem.

h3. Workaround
No workaround yet
fields.summary: Allow multiple Events to be triggered from a Workflow postfunction in Jira

fields.description:
At the moment, the Pie Chart in Jira dashboards have a lot of white spaces on both horizontal and vertical rendering. It is hard to re-use multiple pie charts on external reporting tools when there a lot of wasted white spaces. 

Suggestion :
- Allow to remove the white spaces in the pie chart.
- Have a compact rendering of the pie chart similar to the wallboard rendering.
fields.summary: Compact rendering of Jira Pie Charts

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users using the 'text' email notification format (set in 'Personal Settings') may receive the Atlassian logos (and some icons) as attachments if other users using HTML are also notified for the event.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket in a project where watcher are notified, say, for comments
# Create user A using HTML as email notification format and user B using text
# Add first user A as watcher and then user B
# Comment the ticket making sure both are notified (if you're logged as one, you'll need to set 'notify my own changes')

h3. Expected Results
User B receives text notification, so no attachments should be added.

h3. Actual Results
User B received text notifications with Atlassian logos (and some icons) as attachments:
!attachments.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
HTML format shouldn't cause this problem.
fields.summary: Text notifications may include Atlassian logo as attachments if other users are notified

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Open issues by priority in *Projects* gadget load a blank page when opened

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add *Projects* gadget to your dashboard.
# Edit the gadget to show *Detailed* view so that you can see the *Open Issues(by priority)* bar for each project.
# Click on the *Open Issues(by priority)* bar to see the issues for each priority
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
It redirects you to Issue and Filter section to load the JQL that fetches the issues from the selected project with the chosen priority

h3. Actual Results
It tries to load the JQL results however it ends up loading a blank page with no JQL
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
No workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Open issues by priority in projects gadget loads a blank page when opened

fields.description: Currently when copying a dashboard the gadgets and their settings all copy across but the headings of the gadgets default back to their original state. Would be nice if the headings copied across too.
fields.summary: Copy Dashboard - Copy Gadget Headings

fields.description: Would be great if you could customise a dashboard to only display selected gadgets, and in a selected layout, on the wallboard. Currently have to create two dashboards - one with all information and one with just a couple of gadgets which are needed when sharing in a meeting room on a wallboard. It's an unnecessary duplication if wallboards could just be better customised from the original dashboard.
fields.summary: Customised Wallboards

fields.description: Would be great if the user could create a setting section which includes only settings sections they have selected. I know there is the '.' feature to try and quickly find settings but more convenient would be an area to checkbox select which settings sections are shown when navigating to a new 'User Selected Settings' area.
fields.summary: Customer Settings List

fields.description: When clicking on Starred and recent would be great if Starred Items could be reordered rather than being listed in the order they were added to the starred list.
fields.summary: Reorder Starred Items

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is possible to enter some user information, such as Job Title, Department, location and time zone on the profile page, but it is not possible to pull those informations to the issue view.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Have the ability to pull information from the user profile page to the issue view.
fields.summary: Pull user data from profile page to the issue view

fields.description:
Currently if a user tries to add a JIRA Service Desk portal only customer account as Watcher and has set the browse project permissions to the group *anyone* a 500 error is throw:

!error.png|thumbnail!

Internal log shows:

{noformat}
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: value too long for type character varying(60)
{noformat}

*Notes:*
It seems that the issue is related to portal customers using a hash instead of username.
* [Portal-only customers have a randomly-generated username|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2018/04/portal-only-customers-have-a-randomly-generated-username]

h3. Suggestion:
It would be nice to have a more user-friendly message on UI for the end-customers.
fields.summary: Improve the error message while trying to add a portal only customer as watcher

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The [Configuring sub-task fields displayed on parent issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/configuring-sub-tasks-861254010.html] is not available on new issue view, that are available in old issue view.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the same option to the new issue view.

h3. Workaround
Disable the new issue view. For that follow the steps below:
{panel}
 # Select your avatar and choose Profile
 # Turn off the New Jira issue view toggle under Labs{panel}
fields.summary: Configuring sub-task fields displayed on parent issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer not able to access a user's profile from a group.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to access a user's profile from a group.

h3. Why this is important
Customers would like to access a user's profile from a group.
fields.summary: Ability to access a user's profile from a group

fields.description:
h3. Summary
People field in next-gen does does not browse user in issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add people field to the primary fields in next-gen
# Go to issue view and browse users. It says "No matches found"
 !Screenshot 2019-02-01 at 18.57.13.png|thumbnail! 
# The field works properly in the create screen

h3. Expected Results
The field should browse user and populate the field.

h3. Actual Results
The field does not browse user and populates the field.

h3.Workaround
No Workaround.
fields.summary: People field in next-gen does not browse user in issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, searching for Former Users' contribution is possible only if user retrieves the ID of that person.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice if user is able to search for issues by all Former Users(e.g. "Former User" is shown as suggestion in the dropdown of user selection list in Basic search).

Possible use case: admins can find abandoned issues by searching for issues who's assignee is "Former User"

h3.Workaround
User is still able to search for Former Users one by one, by retrieving their IDs in the following steps:
# Find an contribution of the specific Former User(comment, issue reporter, assignee...)
# Hover on the user name and click the user name link in the pop-up
# Copy the ID in the URL after https://<instance>.atlassian.net/people/
# Use the ID to search in JQL advanced search
fields.summary: Provide the ability to search for Former Users in bulk

fields.description:
Hi there,

 

In you Kanban Jira type, can you please add the Priory status to the Board's View. I cannot see which items have which priority by just looking at the board. This means I have to manually go into 20+ items to find out which ones have a high priority. Just a small icons or text on the ticket in the Board View will help with this a lot!

 

Thanks

Francois Kruger
fields.summary: Add Priority To Ticket View

fields.description: When creating a custom field, Acceptance Criteria for example, I'm not able to choose where the field is shown when viewing and issue. Seems like the field can only be on the right side and it appears very small. Lack of this feature forces us to use description for everything.
fields.summary: Custom field locations

fields.description:
When viewing the backlog and board within a project, I can't seem to filter my view based on the issue type(s). 

Very frustrating.
fields.summary: Filtering view by issue type

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira won't save changes when selecting one of these GMT timezones (La Rioja, San Luis, San Juan, Rio Gallegosany or Buenos Aires). May other timezones are facing the same error.

Instead, it displays the following error message:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-31 at 14.37.44.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on the icon profile -> *Personal settings*;
 # Select one of these GMT timezones (La Rioja, San Luis, San Juan, Rio Gallegosany or Buenos Aires) in the *Your timezone* options;
 # Save changes.

h3. Expected Results

The changes will be saved.
h3. Actual Results

An error message will appear: *Couldn't save your preferences*, something went wrong. Try again.
h3. Workaround

Change the bugged timezone to a similar one that is working properly.
fields.summary: Personal settings cannot be saved for some GMT American timezones

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Unable to copy image URL to insert an image in Test Steps in new Jira Issue view in QMetry for Jira Cloud Add-On


h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
1. Create a Test case in New issue View in Qmetry
2. Attach an image
3. Right Click the image
4. *Copy image Address* option is not available.
5. Hence we can't add an image under Test Steps


h3. Workaround
Workaround is to switch to old issue view in Jira. Following a document created by Qmetry team for the workaroud:

https://qmetrysupport.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/QTMJ/pages/850231339/How+to+add+images+on+Test+Step+level+QTM4J+Cloud

h3. Why this is important

Obtaining the link address is critical as it is required for rendering the image in the Test Step column.
fields.summary: Ability to Copy image URL with New issue View in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we import a workflow from marketplace, it throws an error "Import wizard must be restarted"
h3. Environment
 * jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Workflows
 !Screenshot 2019-01-31 at 8.15.31 PM.png|thumbnail!
 # Click 'Import from Marketplace'
 !Screenshot 2019-01-31 at 8.17.02 PM.png|thumbnail!
 # Select a marketplace workflow
 # Name it and click 'next'
 !Screenshot 2019-01-31 at 8.17.51 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Marketplace Workflow imported into workflows.
h3. Actual Results

Default landing page for marketplace workflows brings up apps (add-ons), which if selected, cannot be added as workflows. If selected, error is displayed.

!Screenshot 2019-01-31 at 8.18.23 PM.png|thumbnail!
{noformat}
Error
Import wizard must be restarted.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Search for "workflows" so that only workflows are displayed in results. Select one of them and proceed

. !Screenshot 2019-01-31 at 8.49.30 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Importing workflow from marketplace throws error "Import wizard must be restarted"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A user with administrators permission at project level when accessing the *Issue layout* feature on a project is seeing a link for the Issue Screen that defines that layout but since the user does not have administrators permission at application level when clicking on the link an access error is being displayed.

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud with new issue view and issue layout features enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user and grant him, Administrator's permission at a project level.
 !permissions.png|thumbnail! 
 !people.png|thumbnail! 
# Log as the user and go to the project
# Access the *Issue layout* feature
 !layout.png|thumbnail! 
# Click the link for the Screen that is defining that issue layout

h3. Expected Results
Since the user does not have administrator's permission at an application level and won't be able to edit the screen no link should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
The user thinks that can edit the screen and when clicking the link it would generate an access error page as the ones below:
 !error.png|thumbnail! 
 !error2.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
At the Screens section of the project the permission is correctly set and there are no links on the Screens, only the information is displayed.
 !atScreen.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround is available.
fields.summary: Issue layout should not display link to issue screens for Administrators at project level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a Jira administrator access a private next-gen projects settings, the left menu does not load

h3. Environment

Next-gen projects in Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a private next-gen project
 # Using another Jira administrator user, follow the steps below:
#* On the left menu, click on *Projects*
#* Next to the next-gen name created in the previous step, click *more(...) > Project settings*

h3. Expected Results

The project settings and the menu load 

h3. Actual Results

The project settings load, but the menu is blank

 !Screen Shot 2019-01-29 at 4.20.11 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

Not for now
fields.summary: When a Jira administrator access a private next-gen projects settings, the left menu does not load

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customers aren't able to create new Jira Issues.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Click on *+* button
 # Enter any vallue
 # Click *Create*

Actual result:
 The issue is not created and it shows this error:
{code:java}
Exception occurred: com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.json.JsonMarshallingException: org.codehaus.jackson.map.JsonMappingException: (was java.lang.NullPointerException) (through reference chain: com.atlassian.jira.quickedit.rest.api.field.QuickEditFields["createdIssueDetails"]->com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.IssueBean["fields"]->java.util.HashMap["customfield_15231"]->com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.lingo.integration.internal.requestlanguage.RequestLanguageJsonData["getDefaultValue()"])
{code}
fields.summary: [Fixed] Some customers unable to create Jira Issues

fields.description:
https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/23/JST-433160

When importing a cloud export (i.e. when restoring from a cloud backup), cloud Jira converts all users to active (even if they are inactive in the entities.xml file.

You can test this. Create a new cloud instance with a couple users, make a couple inactive. Export then restore. The users are converted to active on restore.

(This is particularly problematic if you are on ANNUAL billing. If on annual billing, and you try to restore a cloud backup, it will forever fail if the number of active + inactive users is above your Annual billing licensed number of users, leaving your Jira instance in a state where it is locked by you cannot import the backup. This is because...as the number of users being imported – previous some inactive but now all active – will be above your billing licensed number of users. You will forever get this (very un)helpful error to boot: "Error importing data: com.atlassian.jira.log.clean.PrivacySafeException: Privacy-safe boxing of a com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.UsersAndGroupsImportHelper$WrappingCrowdException")
fields.summary: Inactive users are imported as active

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Work Description field unavailable when logging work in New Issue View

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access an issue
# Click on the Time Tracking field
# Add hours to the field

h3. Expected Results
Work description field should be editable

h3. Actual Results
Work description field completely missing/uneditable
 

h3. Workaround
Disable New Issue View
fields.summary: Work Description field unavailable when logging work in New Issue View

fields.description:
h4.  Summary:
 Some instances are facing intermittent errors to perform bulk operations, if these are involving sub-tasks. We are already investigating the root cause. When it does happen, a generical error 500 screen is shown.

h4. How to reproduce
(!) Not always reproducible (!)

Perform a bulk operation containing sub-tasks

h4. Expected result:
The operations to be performed

h4. Actual result:

The operations are not performed and the following screen is shown:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Workaround
None at the moment

*If you think that you may be affected by this bug, please, contact Atlassian support so we can check if it matches the case or if it is something else*.
fields.summary: Some bulk operations that involve sub-tasks can fail with error 500

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update - April 23,2021}
Hello everyone! We noticed that this report is related to a limitation by design in the Business boards, and should be considered a feature request. Since there is also an existing feature request for this we have decided to merge both issues. This bug report will be closed and the remaining issue will be the feature request JRACLOUD-69930. The affected teams have already been indicated and considered in the feature request and all you need to do is watch that issue.

 
{panel}
h3. Summary

Issues recently created on a business board are not displayed

Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Business project
 # Add more than 1000 issues to this project. (For example 1500)
 # Go to the business board. The first 1000 issues were added to the board (according to the limit of 1000 issues per board)
 # Create a new issue at the bottom of the board

h3. Expected Results

The newest issue should be displayed on the board
h3. Actual Results

The newest issue is not displayed on the board
  
h3. Notes

In the [Business board documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/working-with-boards-800712866.html] we can read:
 * By default, items are listed in the order of oldest to newest by creation date.
 * Issues disappear from the last column after 14 days of inactivity. Select the link at the bottom of this column to see them again.

None of the functionalities described above are working
h3. Workaround

None at the moment
fields.summary: Business board filter only list the first 1000 issues ordered by ascending created date

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user had their user_name changed, Jira will show an error when setting this the user a value of any user picker custom field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a User: *charlie*
# Change their user_name to *atlassian* (customer could have it done themselves prior to the username deprecation). This will cause the user_name to be different from the user_key.
# Create a *user picker* custom field and associate it to a project.
# Create an issue, and under the user picker custom field, search for *atlassian* and set it as the value. Save the field.
# Just edit the field again and try to save it.

h3. Expected Results

The user picker field is successfully saved.

h3. Actual Results

The following error will be displayed: "Could not find usernames: charlie".

In other words, when you edit the field, it parses the user value as user_key instead of their user_name.

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Editing the value of user picker custom fields results in an error if the user had their user_name changed.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The date is displayed as "Invalid date" on the worklog tab in the new issue view
h3. Environment
 * Safari Browser 12.0.2 (14606.3.4)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable new issue view
 # Go to any issue > Click on the worklog tab

h3. Expected Results

Displays worklog date correctly
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Displays as Invalid date
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Click on the "*See the old view*" option above on the right side or you can *disable the Lab option* to use only the old issue view by doing the following:
 # Click on your Avatar on the Left Sidebar > Personal Settings
 # Scroll down to Jira Labs
 # Toggle the button off
fields.summary: Date Is Displayed As Invalid in New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Summary

For a user with a heading space in the username, the user won't be visible in issue's history changes. It has been identified that this is affecting changes for multi-user picker type field.

(i) A username rename to remove the heading space will not fix the behaviour.

h3. Steps to reproduce
None as new users can no longer be created with a heading space.
fields.summary: User with heading space in username is not visible in issue's history

fields.description:
The Projects side menu item is reverted to English only after a (we think recent) change in the front end.

This affects all languages.
fields.summary: "Projects" side-menu item shows in English for all languages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding a rich text gadget to a dashboard and set a wallboard slideshow, the slideshow doesn't load.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Add the [Rich Text Gadget|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214632/rich-text-gadget-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] app to the instance;
# Create a dashboard and add the Rich Text gadget to it;
# Set up a wallboard slide show and click to view the wallboard slideshow.

h3. Expected results

The dashboard is shown in the slideshow.

h3. Actual result

The page keeps loading and never show the information.

h3. Workaround

Remove the Rich Text gadget from the dashboard.
fields.summary: Rich text gadget breaks the view wallboard slideshow

fields.description:
h4. Summary

If one user wants do a bulk operation to *assign issues* for a user and, it doesn't have *Edit Issues* (it only has *assign issues*, for example). Jira will throw a 404 (as its standard for when permissions don't allow) causing confusion.

 h4. How to reproduce

# Have a user with *Assign issues permission* and *without Edit Issues permission* on a project
# Perform a bulk operation with an issue with the above permissions
# Choose 'Edit Issues' operation and choose only to *edit the assignee*
# Try to finish the bulk operation

h4. Actual Result

Jira throws a 404 page due to permission denial

h4. Expected Result

Jira should allow users with assign issues permission to bulk assign issues.
fields.summary: Bulk operation for assigning issues throws 404 (permission error page) if the user doesn't have "edit issues" permission

fields.description:
Currently, on the sidebar, we can only see Jira icon, starred and recent, search and create. 
It would be great if we could add icons to be directly redirected to the apps we need because for now, we need to click a lot of times to find the necessary configuration and if we had this option we could create the icons and paste the direct URL for those apps we frequently use.
fields.summary: Ability to add icons on sidebar
octagon

fields.description:
Currently date/time format settings are in multiple places. This can be quite confusing as you need to change format in different places using different formatting strings.

To change the displayed date/time you need to goto Look and Feel( https://<instance.atlassian.net>/secure/admin/LookAndFeel!default.jspa ).

This doesn't change the date/time pickers formats. To do this you need to go into Advanced settings( https://<instance.atlassian.net>/secure/admin/AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa ) and then select date time picker "jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format" or date picker "jira.date.picker.javascript.format". Also this is in different formats to the above look and feel.

Suggestion: Consolidate date/time configuration in once place and use the consistent  date/time formats
fields.summary: Consolidate Jira date/time format settings

fields.description:
[Edit a project's detail|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/editing-a-project-s-details-938021871.html/] document indicates that the Project Key can be changed with a Project Administration permission. 

The user actually needs the Jira application administration access to be able to change a project key.
fields.summary: Documentation bug for project key admin permission.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the new issue view does not have the "Show All", "Show Open" option for Sub-tasks
 Old issue view
 !image-2019-01-28-19-53-26-788.png|thumbnail! 
 New issue view
 !image-2019-01-28-19-53-46-865.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to control sub-tasks view option
h3. Why this is important

Some issues have a lot of sub-task (open and done), it would be nice to have the option to choose what to display
  
h3. Workaround 

Switch to old issue view: : https://<Cloud URL>/browse/<issue key>?oldIssueView=true
fields.summary: Ability to control sub-tasks view option in new issue view

fields.description:
!Expected.png|thumbnail! h3. Summary

The expand gets hidden in the Jira issue view on browsers with bigger zoom level. 
h3. Customer Impact



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any Jira issue.
# Reduce the window size of the browser or zoom in on the page.
# Check the expand arrow for the details. 

h3. Expected Results

The expand arrows should still be visible.

 !Expected.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The expand arrows are partially hidden.

 !bug.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

The details can still be collapsed or expanded even if the arrow is partially hidden.
fields.summary: Expand arrows hidden on the Jira issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The only way to copy the formatting when copying comments currently, is to edit the comment so you can see the raw wiki markup and copy that.

To do that, all agents need *edit comment* permissions which may be undesirable in certain scenarios and they then need to manually re-apply the formatting.

h3. Suggested Solution
 It would be useful to have a *copy comment* button somewhere next to _edit comment_, that copies the comment to the clipboard with the wiki markup included. For example, anything *bold* would include the surrounding \* \* markup.

h3. Workaround
Allowing users edit comment permission so they can edit the comment and copy from that box
fields.summary: Add a copy comment button that includes the wiki formatting

fields.description:
h3. Summary

For certain active users, workflow post function %%CURRENT_USER%% assigns the issue to "Former User"

For example, the affected user is abc.xyz. By checking the database tables, it's possible to see the duplicates.
||id||user_key||lower_user_name||
|XXXXX|abc.xyz|abc.xyz|
|XXXXX|Abc.Xyz|abc.xyz2|

||id||user_name||lower_user_name||active||display_name||lower_display_name||email_address||lower_email_address||
|XXXXX|Abc.Xyz|abc.xyz|1|Abc Xyz|abc xyz|abc.xyz@domain.com|abc.xyz@domain.com|
|XXXXX|Abc.Xyz2|abc.xyz2|0|Former user|former user| | |
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a post function to workflow transition that assigns %%CURRENT_USER%% to an issue field.
 # An active user performs the transition

h3. Expected Results

Issue field is updated to the username of the user who performed the transition.
h3. Actual Results

Issue field is updated to "Former User"
fields.summary: for some active users workflow post function %%CURRENT_USER%% assigns issue to "Former User"

fields.description:
h3. Description:
In the new text editor, it is possible to create a *code block* section and select the code language to be highlighted. Selecting a language does not make the code highlighted, as the option selected is not maintained.

h3. Steps to reproduce: 
# Open an issue in Jira
# Edit a text field (e.g. Description, comment)
# Click the *code block* button to add a code block
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-25 at 3.51.23 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Add the desired code
# Select the syntax to be highlighted
# Save comment

* Video of bug being reproduced is attached 


h3. Expected result:
Syntax is highlighted

h3. Actual result:
The syntax selected is not maintained

h3. Additional details:
* This can only be reproduced in fabric editor (new issue view)
fields.summary: Code Syntax Highlight is not maintained in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira users are unable to scroll and edit issues on the Issue View screen. This impacts only old Issue View (does not impact the new Issue View). 

h3.Workaround

No workaround available. If affected, please reach out to [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/].
fields.summary: Unable to scroll and edit issues on Issue View screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The functionality of the operator Less than or equal to (<=) is not working correctly towards dates.

JIRA will return the issues that were created before the specified date, but not the ones created on that date.

For example, issue created on 1 April 2018 can’t be found using the below JQL
{code:sql}
createdDate <=2018-04-01
{code}
This is because it will search for issues that are created before 2018-04-01 00:00:00.

h3. Steps to reproduce

* Create an issue via CSV, with created date = 2018-04-01;
* Search for: createdDate <=2018-04-01.

h3. Expected results

The issue with created date *2018-04-01* will be returned in the search.

h3. Actual results

The issue with created date *2018-04-01* is not returned in the search.

h3. Workaround

Search for the date 1 day after the desired one.

For example, you want to look for issues that were created at or before 2018-04-01:
* *createdDate <2018-04-02*.
fields.summary: Less than or equal to (<=) operator does not work correctly towards dates

fields.description: When a link to another issue (for example, XX-12345) is mentioned in the *description* or within the *comments* of the current issue, automatically create a link between the two issues.... this would save users the trouble of having to (a) first discuss the nature of the link in the description or text and then (b) in addition have to manually create the link between the two issues.
fields.summary: Create Issue Links Automatically When Key Mentioned in Description or Comments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Jira, if you use the shortcut question mark \(?\) a list with all shortcuts will be displayed but the shortcut to operations that is the final stop (.) is not included in this list.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the final stop (.) shortcut to the list of shortcuts of Jira help
fields.summary: Include the final stop (.) shortcut in the shortcuts list of Jira help

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Currently, there are no APIs to retrieve the Workflow name of a defined Issue in Jira. This proves problematic when integrating third-party systems that require this information.

A GET all Workflows is available however this is not specific to a particular Issue thus an output cluster of non-needed information.

A GET Issue transition is available however this only provides the possible transitions and does not output transitions with Validators or Conditions and depends on the current status of the Issue.

h2. Proposed solution

To the list of [Workflow|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-api-3-workflow-get] APIs, add an additional "Get Issue Workflow" endpoint.

This will also prove beneficial regarding not being able to get this information in the new issue view as per JRACLOUD-69555.
fields.summary: Get Issue Workflow name API

fields.description:
h3. Description
Using special character like "" on project name causes the Releases/Components and Board page not load

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a project
# Name it using a special character like ""
# Save the name
# At the project page, try to load Releases or Components page will cause it to be blank and not render the UI

h3. Expected
The page should load regardless of the project name

h3. Actual results
The page does not load

h3. Workaround
Remove the special character from project name.
fields.summary: Using special character like "" on project name causes the Releases/Components and Board page not load

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the customer paste's email addresses like  "user1@site.com user2@site.com". It is taken as one email while adding users in a group

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# User management > Groups > Choose a group > Add members
# Paste emails "user1@site.com user2@site.com" in the search box
# It is recognized as one email address instead of separating into two email addresses
 !Screenshot 2019-01-24 at 17.06.20.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The email address pasted as  "user1@site.com user2@site.com"  should be recognized a 2 email addresses

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Adding multiple users to a group does not separate while pasting email address

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the new issue view, pasting table from any source to the issue description and comment fields doesn't get rendered correctly.
h3. Suggested Solution

The wiki-style renderer in new issue view should allow pasting table from any source.
h3. Why this is important

This functionality is essential for users who directly want to paste a table to the description and comment fields. It will be more convenient for users to use this functionality rather than using the existing one to create tables from scratch in wiki style renderer and manually pasting values to it.
fields.summary: Ability to paste tables in Description and Comment fields in New issue view

fields.description:
Sort "Edit Issue Type Screen Scheme Entry" alphabetically for easier visibilty

 !Screenshot_734.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Sort "Edit Issue Type Screen Scheme Entry" alphabetically

fields.description:
h3.*Problem Definition*
Creating a custom field with the multiple users field type and adding that field to a screen then create an issue with populated data. upon editing, some usernames are not identifiable by Jira. As Jira throws an error if the user tries to edit the Screen or Add more users (On the Old Issue view). However no error is thrown on "New Issue view". 

To add a little context, this is as a result of users who's username was changed previously ([*as username is deprecated*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2018/06/say-goodbye-to-usernames-in-atlassian-cloud] and their corresponding userkey stored in the "app_user" table as their 1st username. Hence  if that user still exist in the instance, that field references the userkey which has probably the 1st username. However if that user was removed and another user uses the email address. So on the Old Issue view/ Edit Screen, the field tries to reference the username  but returns a reference to the userkey which does not reflect the current state for a username on that field - hence the error "Could not find username"

{panel:title=Reproducing the Problem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
 - Create a new custom field of type using the *Multiple user* field type which is a "Multi-user picker"
 - Add that custom field to your screens 
 - Add users to the custom field upon issue creation
 - view the Issue after creation by using the "Edit Screen" (Old Issue view) and try to save changes or trying to edit inline (Old Issue view) that custom field, to add more users
- An error is thrown which states, the "Could not find usernames"
-  !issue-view2.png|thumbnail! 
 - switch to the *new issue view* and use inline to edit to add more users and no error is thrown.{panel}

h3. *Expected Result*
 * Custom field should be to add/remove new users on the old issue view or via the "Edit screen" irrespective of userkey value.

h3. *Actual Result*
 * custom field throw an error "Could not find usernames"

h3. *Work Around*
 * Always use the New Issue View (*Personal Settings > Jira Labs - toggle the action button to "ON"*) to be able to work with that custom field. (/)
 !new-issue-view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Additional Workaround*
You will sometimes be forced to use the old issue view like when creating a *Sub-Task* that has mandatory fields on the *Screen*.

In these occasions, you will have to add the concerned users manually to the *multi-user picker* field to avoid the "{color:red}Could not find usernames{color}" error message.
fields.summary: Inconsistency with userkey when using the custom field multiple users "field type" on edit screen view or Old Issue view
Add cloning as a bulk operation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On the project template picker page, there is a button in the footer with the suggestion to "try a next-gen template". However, this option is available on an instance that has only Jira core license and it should be available only if next-gen projects are available on the instance.

Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on "Create project" button from the project directory
 # Click on "Change template" button on the project create screen
 # On the project template picker page, you should see the next-gen footer with "Try a next-gen template"

h3. Expected Results

The footer should only be available to the customers who have next-gen projects.
h3. Actual Results

The button is available to customers with Jira core license, and there are no next-gen projects for Jira core so when the customer clicks on "Try a next-gen template" button, they see an error saying "No templates found".
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: The "try a next-gen template" button is available for Jira core licenses

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When accessing an issue using Firefox, if you try to open a project on a new tab by clicking on the project name on the top-left, Jira ignores the third click to open the project on a new tab and open on the same page. 
 !project drop-down list.png|thumbnail! 

It works on other browsers, like Chrome. See the video below:
 [^Recording #15.mp4] 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access an issue on a project
# Click on the Project name, on the top-right
# Try to open the other project on a new tab using the third click

h3. Expected Results
The project is opened on a new tab

h3. Actual Results
The project open on the same tab

h3. Workaround
User can hold the Crtl/Cmd key on the keyboard and click on the project to open it on a new tab
fields.summary: Jira doesn't open a project on a new tab on FIrefox

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, according to our [How to Access Issue Collector Form without Embedding it in a Page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-access-issue-collector-form-without-embedding-it-in-a-page-826872619.html] documentation, it is not possible to make an Issue Collector directly accessible in the Cloud environment.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability for an Issue Collector to be directly accessible.

h3. Why this is important
This should enhance Jira's customization capabilities.

h3. Workaround 
If the template is set to *"Got feedback?"* or *"Raise a bug"* the following endpoint can be accessible as a workaround: 
{code}  site_URL/rest/collectors/1.0/template/form/<id> {code}
fields.summary: Make Issue Collectors in cloud directly accessible, not only embedded on a HTML page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The sort order of the components list in the drop-down is not ordered.

ie: 'Z' comes before 'a'

h3. Suggested Resolution

Have the ability to reorder the components.
fields.summary: Ability to reorder the components in the create screen view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Permissions can be assigned directly to *users*. In Jira, user records have two different attributes, *user key* and *username*. The bug happens when a user has two different records, as exemplified below:
||User Id||User Key||Username||
|1|A|B|
|2|B|C|

When user *1* is referenced in a permission scheme, Jira will display user *2*'s display name. In case there is no record for user 2, Jira will display user 1's key.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a permission scheme
# Grant a permission to a *single user*
*   !Screen Shot 2019-01-23 at 4.44.55 PM.png|thumbnail! 
** Here, the problem will only occur if the user once had a record that was deactivated and is currently pointed as *Former user* or if there exists a user record that once 

h3. Expected Results
Correct user is displayed

h3. Actual Results
Incorrect user record is displayed:
*  !Screen Shot 2019-01-23 at 4.45.14 PM.png|thumbnail!
** The expected user to be displayed was *FaresGmail*, but the one actually displayed was *Fares Abbes*

h3. Additional Information
Although Jira displays the permission as being granted to a *Former User*, the permission is properly associated with the correct user in the database, so this behavior *does not represent a permission problem*.

h3. Workaround
This problem is not reproduced if the permission scheme is accessed through the project settings page (*Project Settings > Permissions*).
fields.summary: Permission schemes may show incorrect user if permission is granted to "single user"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Import fails when backup contains users with blank e-mails
h3. Environment
 * Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Delete 2 or more users in Jira
 # Generate a backup of the Jira instance
 # Try restoring the backup that was created

h3. Expected Results

Backup restores successfully
h3. Actual Results

Import fails with the following error in UI:
{quote}Error importing data: com.atlassian.jira.log.clean.PrivacySafeException: Privacy-safe boxing of a com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.UsersAndGroupsImportHelper$WrappingCrowdException
{quote}
The logs show:
{code:java}
2019-01-22 14:04:03.989	ERROR	com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.UsersAndGroupsImportHelper	Could not add user <USER>	Found more than one user with email	java.lang.IllegalStateException: Found more than one user with email at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.AbstractInternalDirectory.findUserByEmail(AbstractInternalDirectory.java:263) at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.findUserByEmail(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:246) at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.findUserByEmail(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:337) at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric.findUserByEmail(ApplicationServiceGeneric.java:538) at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.getUserByEmail(CrowdServiceImpl.java:191) at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.DelegatingCrowdService.getUserByEmail(DelegatingCrowdService.java:81) at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.getUserByEmail(FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.java:82) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.UsersAndGroupsImportHelper.transferUsersToCrowd(UsersAndGroupsImportHelper.java:276) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.UsersAndGroupsImportHelper.transferUsersToCrowd(UsersAndGroupsImportHelper.java:255) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.IdentityImportHelper.performMigration(IdentityImportHelper.java:134) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.performTasksOnImportDb(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:397) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.performTasksOnImportDb(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:485) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.lambda$null$1(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:223) at com.atlassian.connpool.impl.AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.java:133) at com.atlassian.jira.connpool.JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.java:131) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$null$0(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:63) at java.util.Optional.map(Optional.java:215) at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$runWithSeparateContextAsync$1(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:62) at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncSupply.run(CompletableFuture.java:1590) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
2019-01-22 14:04:03.989 WARN com.atlassian.crowd.directory.InternalDirectory Found more than one user with email []    2019-01-22 14:04:03.989 WARN com.atlassian.crowd.directory.InternalDirectory Found more than one user with email []    
{code}
h3. Workaround

Extract the entities.xml file from the ZIP archive and remove any lines that contain the following string:
{code:java}
displayName="Former user" lowerDisplayName="former user" emailAddress="" lowerEmailAddress=""
{code}
fields.summary: Import fails when backup contains users with blank e-mails

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
As per following documentation the maximum user count in JIRA cloud is up to 5000 users:
 * [What is the user limit in Atlassian applications?|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confeval/billing-and-licensing-evaluator-resources/licensing/what-is-the-user-limit-in-atlassian-applications]
{quote}*Cloud*

In Atlassian Cloud, the maximum licensed user count is 5000 users (Confluence, JIRA Core, JIRA Software).
For JIRA Service Desk Cloud, there is no limit on the number of 'customers'. For licensed users (in JIRA Service Desk this would be the "agents" role) you can have up to 5000 licensed agents. 
{quote}

h3. Suggested resolution
Please increase this limit, as there are businesses using JIRA cloud where the users could exceed 5000 users.
fields.summary: Increase the user limit in JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
h3.Summary
There are two CSV import options, One is a limited Bulk Create Option available to all users [(covered in "Creating issues using the CSV importer") | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-764478441.html] the other is the external system Import option available to administrators [(covered in "Importing data from CSV") | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-csv-776636762.html].  EXE: the estimation fields are only available in the External System Import method

In the Documentation for Creating issues using the CSV importer:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-764478441.html

Under the section "Tips for importing CSV data into issue fields" it lists Fields that ARE NOT available for this import method, and looks like the table it was copied over from the "Importing data from CSV" documentation where these items do apply, causing confusion between the available options int he Two CSV import options:
* Original Estimate
* Remaining Estimate
* Due Date
* Project
* Comment Body
* Users

h3.Suggested Resolution:
# Please review and verify the available Fields and remove unavailable fields from the list of options on "Creating issues using the CSV importer"
# Add a Note to the page indicating that there are limitations on some fields and refer to ["Importing data from CSV") | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-csv-776636762.html] for additional import options on missing fields
# Add A note to the [Commonly asked CSV questions and known issues | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/commonly-asked-csv-questions-and-known-issues-776636768.html] stressing the differences between the two Import options
# Add Additional links between all three articles with a brief use case description of when to use each of the two CSV import options
fields.summary: Incorrect Fields listed on Create issue from CSV Documentation

fields.description:
At this moment, the _Import External System_ tool in Jira Cloud has very limited options: CSV, Trello and JSON.

Please bring back the possibility to import directly from other tools like Asana, FogBugz, Bugzilla etc.
fields.summary: provide support for importing directly from Asana

fields.description:
Please add the ability to choose column data in teh Admin Projects view.  Similar to the JQL results able to manage the column order.  

 

This would be incredibly helpful when verifying a specific piece of information and/or sorting on that specific information.  

!image-2019-01-22-08-34-32-805.png!
fields.summary: Ability to Add and Sort Columns in Projects Admin List View

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Self-help for the users to be able to delete User Generated Content (UGC) like information in the comments.
h3. Suggested Solution

The customers need an option to delete history as well as there's the option to delete the comments which are however retained in the history. These comments might have some Personal Information in the comments(as a part of UGC).
h3. Why this is important

The workaround that is available is tedious and might cause losing out on some other data which might be otherwise required by them such as the history and some of the required comments will get deleted while cloning. Such comments need to be added one-by-one back to the cloned issue manually.
 
h3. Workaround:

1. Edit the issue and/or comments to remove the unwanted data from everywhere it is visible in the issue.
2. Clone the issue using *More* > *Clone* in the issue action bar. Cloning does not copy history to the new issue.
3. Comments are also not copied by the Clone action so manually copy any essential comments you want to keep into the new issue.
4. Delete the original issue leaving only the cloned copy.
PS: All the history will be removed in the cloned issue and will not be able to track it anyway.
fields.summary: Delete User Generated Content (UGC) due to GDPR Policy
hfhfhf

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When Jira Cloud is imported Full text search may return incorrect results

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create an Jira instance with at least single issue
* Perform backup, restore the backup on different instance
* Run search on imported instance (e.g. text ~ "description")

h3. Expected Results
The search will provide correct results

h3. Actual Results
If 'fts-tokens-initial-pop' upgrade task fails to run. Full text search will provide no results at all.

 
h3. Notes
none

h3.Workaround
Request 'fts-tokens-initial-pop?forceRerun=true' ad hoc upgrade task rerun to fix the problem .
fields.summary: Full text search after Cloud import does not return any results

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the new Jira experience, "View workflow" ability no longer showing on the issue view.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add "View workflow" link to the new issue view.

h3. Why this is important
 * Allow the end users to understand the flow of the operations/business
* Allow the end users to verify the status before making the transition

h3. Workaround 
Click on *See the old view* link to display the issues in the old view which has "View workflow" feature.
fields.summary: Allow viewing the workflow in New Jira experience

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When clicking on the child issue summary from new Jira issue view, the issue neer loads.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a child issue
 # Click on the issue summary from the new issue view

h3. Expected Results

The page redirects to the child issue
h3. Actual Results

The page does not redirect and animation for issue loading keeps going on with few console errors.

!Loading screen.PNG|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Click on the Issue key or switch to the old view.
fields.summary: Issue never loads when clicking on the child issue summary in new issue view

fields.description:
Background: we are software development powerhouse with multiple dev and product teams collaborating on issues in Jira. Current workflow is once task completed to specifications the testing rounds start. During testing rounds product team add comments, with lists of things broken / outstanding. Dev team then add more comments with whats fixed. This rounds go on for quit a while resulting in miles of comments and a hard to use time consuming workflow.

Task: Create ability to add `checklists` - tables of items with 3 columns, first `*description*`, second `*checkbox*` for Dev to indicate they addresses the issue, third `*checkbox*` for product team to indicate they confirm issue addressed. Larger teams / organisations might want a few more checkbox columns for extra layers of testing they do? Add ability to create this checklists in task descriptions and in comments. Make sure we can tick or untick an item in the checkbox list without having to click an edit button anywhere - it should always be clickable.
fields.summary: Checklists in Jira Taks Comments and description

fields.description:
Hello,

I'm trying to start a development project by using Jira.

As far I have understood, Jira Components seem good candidates to, as the name suggest, "componentize" the product I'm developing, using them to define the microservices that my application is built on.

Assuming that each microservice has its own code-base, actually I don't have the chance to link a specific component to a specific repo (and also I can't either specify versions to Components!).

I think it's a common requirement, or does exist a workaround?
fields.summary: Ability to link Jira Components with Bitbucket Repos

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Duplicate user keys were encountered during Jira import

h3. Environment

* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import Jira backup from another Cloud instance

h3. Expected Results

Import completes succesfully

h3. Actual Results

Import fails with the following error in the UI:

{quote}
There was an error importing file jira-export-modified.zip: Validation failed. Following issues were reported:
Duplicate user keys were encountered: <userA>, <userB>, <userC>, etc
{quote}

A similar error shows in the logs:

{code}
2019-01-10 18:27:14.974	WARN	com.atlassian.jira.plugin.backup.ImportValidationTaskRunner	Import validation failed: Duplicate user keys were encountered: <userA>, <userB>, <userC>, etc	 	 
{code}


h3. Notes
Seems to be affecting Cloud -> Cloud migrations
Also seems to be related to case-insensitivity, importer is seeing user keys like userA and usera being the same

h3. Workaround

Edit the entities.xml file and update the duplicate user keys so that they are unique.
The lines you need to edit will start with the following string:

{code}
<ApplicationUser id=
{code}
fields.summary: Duplicate user keys were encountered during Jira import

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Currently, when connecting projects to channels, you need to select one project (and one channel at a time).

h3. *Suggestion*

Change the field, so it is possible to select multiple projects at the same time (perhaps, use checkboxes).

Of course, there will need to have Jira validate the permissions in each project before you select them, so there are no conflicts when trying to pass a restricted projects along with unrestricted ones.
fields.summary: Slack integration: select multiple projects at the same time when subscribing them to channels

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira has the validator "field required on transition", which means the field needs a value added during the transition but does not have a validator to check if a field has or not a valid value on it before the transition.
h3. Suggested Solution

Create a validator that will check if a field has a valid value before allowing the transition to complete, possibly using the operators >,<,=,!=
h3. Workaround

The current workaround is to set a Condition for the transition, but this is a terrible UX since users will have no idea why the button is missing.
fields.summary: Transition Validator to check if a field has a valid value

fields.description:
In the old issue view, if one user accidentally logged a wrong amount of time, say 30h instead of 30m, they could _Edit_ the logged time.

Please bring this functionality in the new issue view as well.
fields.summary: update (correct) _time spent_ in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
Ability to use symbols, emojis, and special characters in the Comment or Description field is missing in the new Jira issue view. When attempting to add it manually using the [Special Characters and symbols|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/use-symbols-emojis-and-special-characters-724764854.html] the symbols are not rendered correctly.

Steps to reproduce
1. Try to add a comment or description in the new issue view using symbols listed at [Special Characters and symbols|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/use-symbols-emojis-and-special-characters-724764854.html]
For Example (/) (!) (x)
2. Save the content  

h3. *Expected Result*
Symbols are rendered.

h3. *Actual Result*
Symbols are not rendered.

h3. *Work Around*
Disable the New Jira Issue View.
-- This can be done by Clicking on the Profile Icon at the bottom left -> *Personal Settings* (or *Profile*). Under the "Labs" section, disable the "New Jira Issue View".
fields.summary: Ability to use symbols, emojis, and special characters in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When uploading an attachment, Jira automatically adds the thumbnail markdown, even if thumbnails are disabled.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access attachment settings
# Disable thumbnails
# Access a ticket and upload an image

h3. Expected Results
As the thumbnails are disabled, Jira it should render the wiki markup as a link to the file:
* [^file]

h3. Actual Results
Jira generates a thumbnail markup anyway.
* !file|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Once the file is uploaded you can click on the attachments dropdown and click on the file name to generate the link:
!attachment.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When uploading an attachment, Jira automatically adds the thumbnail markdown, even if thumbnails are disabled

fields.description:
On a board I can filter the tickets by quick filter, team member, version and/or epic.  This functionality is great, but more often than not I'm confused because I've added too many filters and I can't see the tickets I need to see.

This causes confusion for many users.  For those of us know do understand Jira better, the best we can do is hit the "Clear all filters" link and start over, but better functionality can and should be built.

Please see my attachement for a proposed solution to this issue
fields.summary: On boards, give visibility to which filters are active

fields.description:
Is it possible to get a Users/Assignee field in the JIRA Cloud Subscription? I have multiple people on my team who want direct messages of only their issues. Right now all we can do is spam a single channel with every issue being created. I have attached an image with the idea of what I am talking about.

!image-2019-01-17-11-32-25-311.png|width=692,height=271!
fields.summary: Add a user/assignee field.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Jira cloud, the [CHART]Time in Status which is using the customer field type *Time in Status* is used for reporting in [average time in status gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-use-average-time-in-status-gadget-776998092.html]. Within the custom field configuration, a user is allowed to create a custom field using the *Time in Status* type. This can further be misinterpreted as a standard field type containing data that is user readable.  


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new custom field
# Choose the type *Time in Status*.


h3. Expected Results

*Time in Status* should not be configurable as this field type is not meant to contain data that can be directly used by end users. 

h3. Actual Results

*Time in Status* can be configured and further be added to screens. The actual field created cannot be edited nor viewed. 

h3. Note 

JRACLOUD-60841 is the existing feature request to actually allow reporting of time in status for individual Jira issues.
fields.summary: Misleading Time in Status custom field type

fields.description: Email notification is delayed for certain hours and some users are not receiving the email notifications
fields.summary: Delayed email notifications

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

The options (statuses) won't be retrieved when adding a *Previous state validator* or a *Regular Expression Check* in a transition if there are Next-gen projects in the instance (at least one):
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-16 at 15.46.41.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a Next-gen project in the instance:
** Jira home -> *Projects*;
** *Create project* -> *Try a next-gen project*:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-16 at 15.48.09.png|thumbnail! 
* Try to add a *Previous State Validator* in a transition:
** Select a transition in a workflow -> *Add validator* -> *Previous State Validator*;
** You'll see that it won't be possible to add parameters to it:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-16 at 15.46.41.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

A field with all statuses will be displayed, so you can select which one the transition will validate:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-16 at 15.50.29.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

No option is displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-16 at 15.46.41.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Deleting all Next-gen projects will allow the options to be retrieved.
For the "Previous state validator" another alternative is to use the "Previous State Condition" instead of the validator.
fields.summary: Validators are failing to retrieve options if there are Next-gen projects in the instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is currently not possible to search for words with '_'  inside them. JQL consider _ as a separator.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be good to have the possibility of a search for words that have the '_' character, same as it is on Jira server.
 
h3. Workaround 
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: JQL in Jira Cloud should not consider _ as a separator

fields.description:
to make filters on dashboards without the need for filter editing.
Having an easier field to select the time interval.

!https://support.content.office.net/en-us/media/3de01aaa-4a5d-4f39-a2b1-d57aab125c45.png!
fields.summary: Dashboard with filters of time

fields.description:
Currently, Notifications are sent for all the changes happening for an issue based on the notification schema.
Customer wants a functionality in which notifications will be sent based on certain conditions like based on components, the issue in the active sprint and all
fields.summary: Notification based on Conditions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers having multiple issue types would like the resolution field options to customized accordingly. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Customers having multiple issue types should be able to customize the resolution field options.

h3. Why this is important
Customers having multiple issue types would like the resolution field options to customized accordingly. As all resolution options may not be valid for other issue types.
fields.summary: Ability change resolution field options based on issue types

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you try to use JQL to search for issues with exact string using \", *for example: "\" exact string \""*, it should only find issues matching the whole expression, but it is finding issues containing the separate words.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to the 'Search Issues' screen.
2. Try searching for issues with an exact string using \", as the example below:
{code:java}
text ~ "\"this is an example\""
{code}

h3. Expected Results
You will find all the issues that contain the exact string (whole expression) 'this is an example'.

h3. Actual Results
All issues that contain all the separate words.

h3. Workaround
It doesn't have a workaround.
fields.summary: Searching for an exact string using JQL with \" is not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Creating projects in new Jira cloud instances fail with "Project not created" error.
h3. Environment

New Jira cloud instances
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Atlassian site with Jira software.
 # Try to create a project.

h3. Expected Results

The Project is created.
h3. Actual Results

Jira throws "Project not created; for some reason, the magic did not happen" error.
h3. Workaround

If the Story issue type is a sub-task:
* Change the name of the issue type
* Try creating a new project

If not, please contact [Atlassian support|https://support.atlassian.com/].
fields.summary: Unable to create project in new cloud instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When listing issues of a filter, the rendering of the filter's name is cut a few pixels in its bottom.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Click any filter to show its result ("My open issues", for example).

h3. Expected Results
* The name of the filter is completely rendered.

 !My open issues right.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* The name of the filter is rendered with 1 or 2 lines of pixels missing.

 !My open issues wrong.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround(s)
* At this moment, there is none.
fields.summary: When listing issues of a filter, the filter's name is cut in its bottom

fields.description:
We are creating a Jira cloud mobile app where the user loggs in with OAuth.

From the app, the user gets redirected to Jira where he can log in. After that the user is redirected to OAuth authorise page. There the user can authorise the app and then he is redirected back to the app.

The problem is the sidebar, it is taking up too much space on the mobile device.

We would like to hide the sidebar while authorising. This might be implemented with a query parameter.

For example:
[https://id.atlassian.com/login?continue=OUROAUTHPAGE?hideSidebar=true]
fields.summary: Hide Jira Sidebar while authorising with OAuth (for a mobile app)

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*
 * Creating a custom field with the Radio buttons field type disappears when you try to change the value on the new issue view.

 
{panel:title=Reproducing the Problem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
 - Create a new custom field of type using the *Radio Buttons* field type
 - Add that custom field to your screens
 - Set the custom field to hold at least two value e.g. "Yes" and "No"
 - Create an issue and set choose a value while creating the issue on the custom field.
 - view the Issue after creation and the custom field is present on the *new issue view.*
 - Try to change the value and it disappears.
 - switch to the *old issue view* and the custom field is visible and its values interchangeable.{panel}
h3. *Expected Result*
 * You should be able to change the value of the Custom field "Radio button" on the right column on the new issue view

h3. *Actual Result*
 * custom field is visible, attempting to change the value makes the field to disappear from the new issue view

h3. *Work Around*
 * Switch to the Old Issue view to be able to see the custom field.
{quote}OR
{quote}
 * Create a custom field using the *Select List (single choice)* Field type instead.
fields.summary: Custom field created using the Radio buttons field type disappears on the new issue view
